New Records: The Los Angeles Angels secured their fifth walk-off victory of the season with a 4-3 win over the Chicago White Sox on September 18, 2024.
Key Match Events: The game went into extra innings with the Angels winning 4-3 in the 13th inning.
Eric Wagaman scored the winning run with a walk-off single after Jordyn Adams' grounder deflected off Miguel Vargas' glove.
The bases were loaded in the 10th and 12th innings but the Angels finally won in the 13th.
The White Sox had the bases loaded in the 13th inning but José Quijada struck out Yoán Moncada to end the threat.
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox were aiming for their first win in four months and a series victory, but the Angels ended their streak.
Andrew Vaughn hit his 19th home run, driving in the tying run in the fourth inning.
The Angels evened the game in the eighth inning with Taylor Ward's line drive scoring Zach Neto.
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington praised the team's resilience after the comeback win.
White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore emphasized focusing on the next series despite the loss streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox were on track for their 117th loss, tying them with the 1916 Philadelphia Athletics for third most losses since 1900.
The Angels' next series is against the Houston Astros, with José Suarez set to start on September 19.
Others: The game marked Yoán Moncada's return from a left adductor strain, activated from the 60-day injured list on September 16.
